resources.string: This application acts as a gateway to a collection of my mathematical pattern drawing algorithms, Please click on the icon representing the type of pattern you would like to explore further.
This parameter is the number of points on the star. It can be any integer value in the range 3 to 101.

This parameter is the number of points advanced by each edge vector. One will draw a simple polygon, larger numbers will draw stars. If n1 and n2 have a factor in common the resulting star will be simplified by that factor, for instance, (10,4) will draw the star (5,2).
This parameter determines the number of copies of the star that will be drawn. Each copy will be rotated and shrunk, based on the values of the relevant parameters.
This parameter determines the number that each copy of the original pattern will be rotated.
This parameter determines by how much to shrink each copy of the original pattern. It is a percentage, 0 is full size, 5 will reduce each successive image by 5%.
This is the colour of the line use to draw the first pattern and the start of the sequence when drawing multiple patterns
This is the last colour in the sequence when drawing multiple patterns, intermediate patterns are drawn using a blend of the 2.
This is the colour used to fill in the background upon which the pattern is drawn
Here you can configure the settings used to manage the star drawing, including bitmap size, randomiser settings and the animator.
